title: Represent and analyze - x-t graph - find velocity

content.question: The graph shows the position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for an object in one-dimensional simple harmonic motion. Which of the following expressions gives the object’s velocity as a function of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.2 pi meters per second, close parenthesis, the sine of, open bracket, open parenthesis, 0.5 pi s to the negative 1 power, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative, open parenthesis, 0.2 pi meters per second, close parenthesis, the cosine of, open bracket, open parenthesis, 0.5 pi s to the negative 1 power, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.8 pi meters per second, close parenthesis, the sine of, open bracket, open parenthesis, 2 pi s to the negative 1 power, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>8</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative, open parenthesis, 0.8 pi meters per second, close parenthesis, the cosine of, open bracket, open parenthesis, 2 pi s to the negative 1 power, close parenthesis, t, close bracket, degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>8</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0.2 pi meters per second, close parenthesis, the sine of, open bracket, open parenthesis, 0.5 pi s to the negative 1 power, close parenthesis, t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mfrac><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>s</mtext></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
